title: Organic Chemistry Words
description: Master the vocabulary of organic chemistry, from carbon compounds and functional groups to polymers and biochemical reactions.

questions.question: What is a 'hydrocarbon'?
options: A compound made up of only hydrogen and carbon atoms

questions.question: What is a 'polymer'?
options: A large molecule made up of repeating smaller units called monomers

questions.question: What does 'isomer' mean?
options: Molecules with the same chemical formula but different structural arrangements

questions.question: What is an 'ester'?
options: A compound formed from a reaction between an acid and an alcohol, often with fruity smells

questions.question: What is 'saturation' in organic chemistry?
options: When a solution is too concentrated
When a carbon compound has only single bonds and no more hydrogen atoms can be added

questions.question: What is a 'functional group'?
options: A specific grouping of atoms within a molecule that determines its chemical properties
A group of scientists working together
The main element in a compound

questions.question: What does 'alkane' refer to?
options: A saturated hydrocarbon with only single bonds between carbon atoms

questions.question: What is 'benzene'?
options: A six-carbon aromatic ring compound that is a fundamental structure in organic chemistry

questions.question: What is an 'amino acid'?
options: An organic molecule that serves as a building block of proteins

questions.question: What does 'polymerization' describe?
options: The chemical process of joining monomers to form a polymer chain
Heating a substance to its boiling point

questions.question: What is an 'aldehyde'?
options: An organic compound containing a carbon-hydrogen-oxygen group (CHO) at the end of a carbon chain

questions.question: What does 'chirality' refer to?
options: The property of a molecule that is not superimposable on its mirror image
The boiling point of a liquid

questions.question: What is a 'carbohydrate'?
options: A compound made of carbon and metal
A compound with only carbon atoms
An organic compound of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen, including sugars and starches

questions.question: What is 'cracking' in organic chemistry?
options: The process of breaking down large hydrocarbon molecules into smaller, more useful ones

questions.question: What is an 'ethanol'?
options: A two-carbon alcohol commonly found in alcoholic beverages and used as a fuel
